sen.j: 延鎮（えんちん、生没年不詳）は、平安時代前期の法相宗の僧。
sen.e: Enchin (date of birth and death unknown) was a priest of Hosso sect of early Heian period.
Enchin (dates of birth and death unknown) was a priest of the Hosso sect of the early Heian period.
Enchin (dates of birth and death unknown) was a priest of the Hosso sect of the early Heian period.

sen.j: 奈良の報恩法師の弟子となり、778年（宝亀9年）京都東山にある多くの峰のうちの一つ乙輪山（音羽山）に移ったという。
sen.e: It is said that he became a disciple of Hoon-hoshi of Nara and in 778, he moved to Otowa-yama Mountain, one of many peaks at Higashiyama, Kyoto.
It is said that he became a disciple of Hoon-hoshi of Nara, and in 778 he moved to Otowa-yama Mountain, one of many peaks at Higashiyama, Kyoto.
It is said that he became a disciple of Hoon-hoshi of Nara, and in 778 he moved to Mt. Otowa, one of many peaks at Higashiyama, Kyoto.

sen.j: 798年（延暦17年）坂上田村麻呂は乙輪山に山荘を作り、その後延鎮を開山として招き現在の清水寺を創建したと伝えられている。
sen.e: It is said in tradition that SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro built a mountain villa at the Otowa-yama mountain in 798, and later he invited Enchin as a founder to establish today's Kiyomizudera Temple.
Tradition says that SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro built a mountain villa at Otowa-yama mountain in 798, and he later invited Enchin as a founder to establish today's Kiyomizudera Temple.
Tradition says that SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro built a mountain villa on Mt. Otowa in 798, and he later invited Enchin as a founder to establish today's Kiyomizu-dera Temple.

sen.j: 延鎮の晩年については不明である。
sen.e: The later days of Enchin is unknown.
